timeline.message: Use exponential backoff for ZooKeeper restart

timeline.bodyText:
I think this should have worked as follows:

quorumPeer.running should be set to false (under a synchronized(quorumPeer)), which means the quorumPeer thread will eventually exit its thread
wait until quorumPeer thread exits with quorumPeer.join(),
then do the rest of shutdown() tearing down resources.

As it is now (3) happens before (2), tearing down resources that might be used concurrently by the quorum peer thread.
And (2) may happen a long time after we return from this method, meaning it may still run concurrently with trying to start another instance of ZK.
timeline.author: hakonhall

Yes, will fix.

Yes, there any many reasons that the old server will linger. Component destruction only happens after 60s for example. This is why server start is retried.
